ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
1=Neither fidgety nor agitated in movement; 3=Fidgety and restless but remained at table throughout evaluation; 5=Could not remain at table at all
1=Consistently attended to tasks with some age appropriate distractibility; 3=Attentional capacity variable; 5=Attentional difficulties seriously interfered with all tasks
1=Waited for items to be administered before handling objects; 3=Occasionally touched or grabbed test materials without permission; 5=Highly impulsive

1= Highly talkative and extraverted (e.g., made several attempts to interact with the examiner); 3= Did not initiate but responded to conversations initiated by the examiner; 5= Reluctant to engage with examiner (e.g., withdrawn)

1= Mood primarily characterized by positive affect (e.g., smiling, laughing, etc.); 3= Full range of affect displayed during assessment; 5= Child appeared depressed or upset (e.g., cried or was tearful) for most of the assessment
